metadata.Title: CVE-2022-41721 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description: A request smuggling attack is possible when using MaxBytesHandler. When using MaxBytesHandler, the body of an HTTP request is not fully consumed. When the server attempts to read HTTP2 frames from the connection, it will instead be reading the body of the HTTP request, which could be attacker-manipulated to represent arbitrary HTTP2 requests.

notes.Note: alexmurray> google-guest-agent contains a vendored copy of golang-golang-x-net

criterions.comment: google-guest-agent: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
